How convenient! You've been blown into handy, bite-sized chunks. I guess that Space Piston article wasn't fiction. There's nothing quite like stretching out and enjoying the wide-open spaces.
Get closer.

Dropping your survival kit on the Spider Droid might prove hazardous to your survival.
What a great idea! You could get him wet, then wait around for the next fifty years for him to rust out. On second thought, you decide to skip it.
You couldn't even make a scratch on this guy.
You attemp to drop the piece of plant down onto the Spider Droid, but it sticks to your fingers. Better try something else.
You find yourself reluctant to part with this dainty souvenir of the plant Kerona.
If it could survive atmospheric entry and the jarring landing, you surely can't upset it.
Chills run down your spin as you realize he has no concept of the word son.
You don't even want to begin to imagine what that might be about!
You wonder when game designers are ever going to stop using that same old, worn out cliche about people killing you after telling you something secret.
